1.heading: Jim.
1.title: "The Adventures of Jim"
1.author: by Luc Cornillon
1.appears_in: p. 67-72 in Heavy Metal, v. 3, no. 7 (Nov. 1979).
notes: Contents page title: "Jim."

2.heading: Jim.
2.title: "Call It a Hunch, Jim, but It's a Powerful Hunch"
2.author: Frank Bolle.
notes: Summary: Mr. Winkle wants to examine the corporate relationsips of Wright International.

3.heading: Jim.
3.title: "The Challenge of Aztarn"
3.author: art: George Evans
notes: Villains are Voltamen, and Aztarn (introduced); introduction of Jim, Alice, and Kermit (a family), Jack and Pete (two boys).
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

4.heading: Jim.
4.title: Cry Yourself to Sleep
4.author: Jeremy Tinder.
notes: "Cry yourself to sleep explores the disappointments of early adulthood by following three lives: Jim a minimum wage rabbit struggling to pay his rent; Andy, an aspiring novelist dealing with rejection; and the Robot, a machine who just wants to be a better man. In this stellar debut, Jeremy Tinder uses sad, sweet humor to tell a quirky little story about pride-swallowing, fake moustaches, car crashes and friendship."

(Marvel Absurd)

physical description.dimensions: 31 cm. 1. British comics. I. Briggs, Raymond. II. Hamish Hamilton Childrens Books Ltd. k. Jim, Gentleman. Call no.: PN6737.B7G4 1980

7.heading: Jim.
7.title: "The Ghostly Mission of Lucy Preston"
7.author: Alex Blum, art
notes: Introduction of Lucy Preston, Tommy Preston, Jim, Sister Death, and Sister Life ; villains Nick, Jake, Nell and other kidnappers are also introduced.
Data from Lou Mougin, Henry Steele, Hames Ware & Jim Vadeboncoeur Jr. via Grand Comics Database Project.

8.heading: Jim.
8.title: "The Heart Awakens!" 7 p. in My Romantic Adventures, no. 95
8.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Once with Jim, I'd know a time when all my hours sparkled like diamonds of joy!"

9.heading: Jim.
9.title: "I'll Stop at the Dentist's First"
9.author: by Merrill Blosser.
notes: Summary: Danny tells June he's getting his upper plate tightened, when really he's tricking her back to her old boy friend, Jim.

11.heading: Jim.
11.title: "Killers Die Alone!"
11.author: Tony De Zuniga, illustrator ; John Albano, writer
11.appears_in: 12 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 14 (Oct./Nov. 1972) ; reprinted in Jonah Hex and Other Western Tales, no. 3 (Jan./Feb. 1980) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Jonah is bushwhacked by two brothers who want revenge for Jonah killing their third brother. Jonah is staked out in the desert to die. Iron Jaws dies while rescuing Jonah.
Appearances of Jim (a doctor), Butcher, and Dan.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

12.heading: Jim.
12.title: "Mystery of the Vanishing Men"
12.author: art: Alex Blum
notes: Title from cover.
Introduces Carol, Jim and other scientists; villains are a tyrant of Mysto (introduced) and a monster (introduced and dies).
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

13.heading: Jim.
13.title: "No Turning Back"
13.author: pencils, Al Williamson ; inks, George Woodbridge
13.appears_in: 5 p. in Outlaw Kid, no. 9 (Dec. 1971) ; reprinted from Outlaw Kid, no. 8 (Nov. 1955).
notes: Begins: "Well, how did I do, chief? Great Jim!"
Data from Lou Mougin and Tony R. Rose via Grand Comics Database Project.

14.heading: Jim.
14.title: "Photo of Organized Bathroom Cabinet"
14.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Compares the photos on the desks of Cathy and her co-workers Andrea, Jim and Roger.

15.heading: Jim.
15.title: "Retribution For Nan"
15.author: art: John Cavallo
notes: Appearances of Jim, Nan (dies), Jim's father, Froggy, and Sinda.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

16.heading: Jim.
16.title: "Side By Side" 4 p. in My Love Story, no. 5
16.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "I wasn't the strong, assertive type, and I suppose that made Jim all the more important!"

17.heading: Jim.

18.heading: Jim.
18.title: "Trouble at Twin Trails" p. 26-31 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 13, no. 10
18.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Bull and Scotty were thrown into the rapids when their canoe capsized. Jim and Fuzzy, unable to help, watch as they are swept downstream.
"To be continued."

19.heading: Jim.
19.title: "When Love Comes Along" 2 p. text in My Own Romance, no. 37

notes: Begins: "When I think how I almost lost my husband, Jim, I feel empty inside."

90.heading: Jim Crow Laws.
90.title: Satchel Paige : Striking out Jim Crow
90.author: by James Sturm & Rich Tommaso ; with an introduction by Gerald Early.
notes: At head of title: Center for Cartoon Studies presents.
A Junior Library Guild selection.

Summary (from OCLC): Satchel Paige began his baseball career in the Negro Leagues in Alabama in the 1920s. For years, Jim Crow laws, which segregated blacks and whites, kept him out of the major leagues. But they couldn't stop him from becoming a world-class athlete.
